summary: In this context, 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethene (PCE) is identified as a chlorinated volatile organic compound (Cl-VOC) that contributes to widespread pollution problems in aquifers. The discussion highlights the degradation of PCE and its correlation with other degradation products, emphasizing its role as an organic chemical that poses environmental contamination risks. The relationship is framed within the broader category of organic chemicals, particularly those that are volatile and chlorinated, which are known to contaminate water sources.
